intro: Hieracium copholepium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and upright. Hieracium copholepium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
